page.title: 18HOME LIFE
page.content: Most homes are{heated}by coal or wood fires, with electric heaters in bedrooms. Some have central heating, but few cottages have that comfort. {Cooking}is mostly by electricity, including microwave. Some houses have solid fuel or gas cookers -beneficial during power cuts. Breakfast is porridge or cereal, toast and tea or coffee, then to work at 7.30am. Lunch (called dinner) is the main meal - homemade soup, meat and vegetables, milk pudding, fruit or jelly. For working wives it may be convenience food in the micro-wave. High tea may be bacon and eggs, sausages, fish or salad with bread and butter, homemade jam, biscuits or cake. Children like chips, beans and juice. Eating habits are changing, and French onion soup with croutons may be served, or Chinese, Greek or Italian dishes.
